content:
You are a reader assistant. You simplify a passage from a scientific paper to make it more readable by performing an iterative algorithm that focuses on atomic changes.

You are also given two parameters: DC (Desired Complexity) – a desired complexity of the simplified text, and ILT (Information Loss Tolerance) – a threshold for information loss compared to original passage that specifies whether an atomic change should be accepted or not.

The algorithm is as follows:
1. Determine if the text is at desired complexity (DC), if yes, terminate the algorithm, else continue.
2. Identify a section of the text whose complexity is above DC.
3. Propose a simplification of the identified section.
4. Identify information loss and the severity of it – if the severity for any of the information loss questions is higher than information loss tolerance (ILT), reject changes, else update the current state of the passage
5. Adjust the passage to maintain readability and flow of text, then run a new iteration of the algorithm.

When the algorithm terminates, you print the final simplified passage

When responding to prompts, only respond to the given question and do not proceed to the next step

The passage:
In this work, we extend our method to work with a new robot arm - Kuka LBR iiwa, which has a significantly different appearance and an additional joint.

DC: University student
ILT: Medium
Identify which parts of the text are the most complex, then the complexity level of the passage. Limit your answer to a maximum of 5 sentences

The most complex parts of the text are: "Kuka LBR iiwa" and "which has a significantly different appearance and an additional joint." These two phrases contain technical jargon and complex sentence structures that contribute to the high complexity of the passage. The overall complexity level of the passage is high, likely around 8 or 9 out of 10, due to the specialized vocabulary and intricate sentence structure. The passage is written at a level suitable for experts in the field, but may be challenging for non-experts or those without a background in robotics.
Is determined complexity higher than DC (University student)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
Yes
Identify a single complicated section of the passage. Remember to respect the ILT (Medium) contraint. Only provide the identified section
"which has a significantly different appearance and an additional joint"
Simplify this section. Only provide the proposed simplification
"has a different appearance and an extra joint"
Reincorporate the simplified section into the passage
In this work, we extend our method to work with a new robot arm - Kuka LBR iiwa, which has a different appearance and an extra joint.

Identify information loss and its severity in the updated passage compared to the original. Comparison must be between the originally provided (the very first) passage and the current simplified version. Limit your answer to a maximum of 5 sentences

The original passage mentions that the Kuka LBR iiwa has "a significantly different appearance and an additional joint", while the simplified version states "a different appearance and an extra joint". The information loss is that the simplification loses the nuance of "significantly different" and the specificity of "additional joint", which is a moderate loss of information. The severity of the information loss is medium-high, as it may affect the reader's understanding of the robot arm's characteristics, but the overall meaning of the sentence remains clear. The loss of "significantly" and "additional" is a minor loss, but "extra" is a more general term that could be misleading.
What is the highest severity level identified in your last answer? Is it higher than ILT (Medium)? Provide the highest severity level, followed by an answer to the ILT question as "Yes" or "No"

Medium-high

No
Identify which parts of the text are the most complex, then the complexity level of the passage. Limit your answer to a maximum of 5 sentences

The most complex part of the text is "In this work, we extend our method to work with a new robot arm - Kuka LBR iiwa". The rest of the text is relatively simple. The sentence structure and vocabulary are straightforward, and the sentence is short and concise. The overall complexity level of the passage is around 2 or 3 out of 10, as it is written at a relatively simple level, suitable for a general audience. The complexity is low due to the short sentence length and basic vocabulary.
Is determined complexity higher than DC (University student)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
No
Print the final version of the simplified passage, include only the text of the passage with no comments or additional punctuation, and do not provide the original passage
In this work we extend our method to work with a new robot arm - Kuka LBR iiwa has a different appearance and an extra joint.
